Events that occurred on 2 January

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1917 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to the War Office.
1929 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to E.V. Gordon.
1941 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 41.
1965 - The thirteenth episode of the Princess-serialization of The Hobbit is published.
1967 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Otto B. Lindhardt.
1967 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Peyton Moss.
1969 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 308.
1969 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 309.
1972 â€“ In honour of his 80th birthday the following day, The Sunday Times Magazine runs an interview of William Cater with J.R.R. Tolkien, "The Lord of the Legends".
2004 - The Art of The Return of the King is published.
2004 - The Lord of the Rings Complete Visual Companion is published.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
Conclusion of the six-day Yuletide festival in the Shire Calendar.
T.A. 3019:
The Fellowship of the Ring travels south along the Misty Mountains.
